quotes.body: They were saying computers deal with numbers. This was absolutely nonsense. Computers deal with arbitrary information of any kind.

quotes.author: Ted Nelson
quotes.body: Right now you are a prisoner of each application you use. You have only the options that were given you by the developer of that application.

quotes.author: Ray Ozzie
quotes.body: Complexity kills. It sucks the life out of developers, it makes products difficult to plan, build and test, it introduces security challenges and it causes end-user and administrator frustration.

quotes.author: Niklaus Wirth
quotes.body: Software gets slower faster than hardware gets faster.

quotes.author: David Parnas
quotes.body: A computer is a stupid machine with the ability to do incredibly smart things, while computer programmers are smart people with the ability to do incredibly stupid things. They are, in short, a perfect match.

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.body: A few months writing code can save you a few hours in design.

quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.body: Are you quite sure that all those bells and whistles, all those wonderful facilities of your so called powerful programming languages, belong to the solution set rather than the problem set?

quotes.author: John von Neumann
quotes.body: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.

quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quotes.body: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do it blows your whole leg off.

quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup
quotes.body: If you think it's simple, then you have misunderstood the problem.

quotes.author: Rob Pike
quotes.body: Object-oriented design is the roman numerals of computing.

quotes.author: Steve Jobs
quotes.body: It is hard to think that a $2 billion company with 4,300-plus people couldn't compete with six people in blue jeans.

quotes.author: Jamie Zawinski
quotes.body: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think ‘I know, I’ll use regular expressions.’ Now they have two problems.

quotes.author: Bill Gates
quotes.body: Sometimes we do get taken by surprise. For example, when the Internet came along, we had it as a fifth or sixth priority.

quotes.author: Ward Cunningham
quotes.body: It was a turning point in my programming career when I realized that I didn't have to win every argument.

quotes.author: Vint Cerf
quotes.body: And programming computers was so fascinating. You create your own little universe, and then it does what you tell it to do.

quotes.author: Joshua Bloch
quotes.body: The cleaner and nicer the program, the faster it's going to run. And if it doesn't, it'll be easy to make it fast.

quotes.author: Philip Greenspun
quotes.body: SQL, Lisp, and Haskell are the only programming languages that I've seen where one spends more time thinking than typing.

quotes.author: Alan Perlis
quotes.body: It is better to have 100 functions operate on one data structure than to have 10 functions operate on 10 data structures.

quotes.author: Brian Kernighan
quotes.body: The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements.

quotes.author: Marvin Minsky
quotes.body: Computer languages of the future will be more concerned with goals and less with procedures specified by the programmer.

quotes.author: Alan Turing
quotes.body: A computer would deserve to be called intelligent if it could deceive a human into believing that it was human.

quotes.author: Joseph Yoder (computer scientist)
quotes.body: The way to arrest entropy in software is to refactor it.

quotes.author: Joseph Yoder (computer scientist)
quotes.body: Reviews and pair programming provide programmers with something their work would not otherwise have: an audience. Sunlight, it is said is a powerful disinfectant. An immediate audience of one's peers provides immediate incentives to programmers to keep their code clear and comprehensible, as well as functional.

quotes.author: John Romero
quotes.body: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession. It's logic-based creativity.

quotes.author: Douglas Crockford
quotes.body: JavaScript is the only language that I'm aware of that people feel they don't need to learn before they start using it.

quotes.author: Addy Osmani
quotes.body: Be humble, communicate clearly, and respect others. It costs nothing to be kind, but the impact is priceless.

quotes.author: Pete Cordell
quotes.body: Telling a programmer there's already a library to do X is like telling a songwriter there's already a song about love.

quotes.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle
quotes.body: Should array indices start at 0 or 1? My compromise of 0.5 was rejected without, I thought, proper consideration.

quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra
quotes.body: The purpose of abstraction is not to be vague, but to create a new semantic level in which one can be absolutely precise.

quotes.author: Elon Musk
quotes.body: There certainly will be job disruption. Because what's going to happen is robots will be able to do everything better than us.

quotes.author: John Carmack
quotes.body: Sometimes, the elegant implementation is a function. Not a method. Not a class. Not a framework. Just a function.

quotes.author: Marvin Minsky
quotes.body: Artificial intelligence is the science of making machines do things that would require intelligence if done by men.

quotes.author: Tim Berners-Lee
quotes.body: I just had to take the hypertext idea and connect it to the TCP and DNS ideas and — ta-da!— the World Wide Web.

quotes.author: Hal Abelson
quotes.body: A computational process is indeed much like a sorcerer's idea of a spirit. It cannot be seen or touched. It is not composed of matter at all. However, it is very real. It can perform intellectual work. It can answer questions. It can affect the world by disbursing money at a bank or by controlling a robot arm in a factory.

quotes.author: Fred Brooks
quotes.body: One must assume that there will be lots of bugs, and plan an orderly procedure for snaking them out.

quotes.author: Fred Brooks
quotes.body: To achieve conceptual integrity, a design must proceed from one mind or a small group of agreeing minds.

quotes.author: Tom DeMarco
quotes.body: The very best technology never has as much impact as girlfriend or boyfriend trouble.

quotes.author: Fred Brooks
quotes.body: Maintenance cost is strongly affected by the number of users. More users find more bugs.

quotes.author: Daniel T. Barry
quotes.body: Most errors are introduced during requirements specification!

quotes.author: Harlan Mills
quotes.body: Programming is similar to a game of golf. The point is not getting the ball in the hole but how many strokes it takes.

quotes.author: Daniel T. Barry
quotes.body: A number of studies have shown testing not very effective at finding bugs.

quotes.author: Daniel T. Barry
quotes.body: The key to keeping software costs down is to write code that is easily modified.

quotes.author: Daniel T. Barry
quotes.body: The notions of correctness in mathematics and programs are different. A mathematical model must be consistent; it need not match reality (be correct), and it need not be complete (in the formal sense). A program model must be consistent; it must match reality; and it must be complete (in the sense that it reacts gracefully to all inputs).

quotes.author: Daniel T. Barry
quotes.body: Programming is at least as difficult as developing a mathematical theory.

quotes.author: Richard Stallman
quotes.body: In 1971 when I joined the staff of the MIT Artificial Intelligence lab, all of us who helped develop the operating system software, we called ourselves hackers. We were not breaking any laws, at least not in doing the hacking we were paid to do. We were developing software and we were having fun. Hacking refers to the spirit of fun in which we were developing software.

quotes.author: Maurice Wilkes
quotes.body: By June 1949 people had begun to realize that it was not so easy to get programs right as at one time appeared.

quotes.author: Butler Lampson
quotes.body: Everything should be made as simple as possible. But to do that you have to master complexity.

quotes.author: Wayne Ratliff
quotes.body: If I had followed my heart instead of advice, dBASE would be much closer to perfection today.

quotes.author: Wayne Ratliff
quotes.body: Programming is a little bit like the army. Now that I'm out, it's neat to have had the experience.

quotes.author: Jonathan Sachs
quotes.body: I don't like using any tools or programs I didn't write myself or that I don't have some control over.

quotes.author: Bob Frankston
quotes.body:
If you cannot explain a program to yourself, the chance of the
computer getting it right is pretty small.

quotes.author: Gary Kildall
quotes.body: I don't comment on the code itself because I feel that properly written code is very much self-documented.

quotes.author: Gary Kildall
quotes.body: When a program is clean and neat, nicely structured, and consistent, it can be beautiful.

quotes.author: Douglas Crockford
quotes.body: JavaScript, purely by accident, has become the most popular programming language in the world.

quotes.author: L. Peter Deutsch
quotes.body: Software is a discipline of detail, and that is a deep, horrendous fundamental problem with software.

quotes.author: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
quotes.body: Even in the games of children there are things to interest the greatest mathematician.
